intro: Zeuxine inverta, commonly known as the inverted zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually small and white or pale yellow, with five petals that are slightly notched at the edges. Zeuxine inverta is notable for its delicate appearance and its role in the ecological diversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
